placeholder.kongManager: Filter by exact name or ID

empty_state.title: Configure a New Route
empty_state.description: Routes proxy requests to an associated Service.

delete.title: Delete a Route
delete.description: Deleting this route will also remove any associated plugins. This action cannot be reversed.

errors.delete: The route could not be deleted at this time.

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information will help you identify and manage this route

config.title: Route Configuration
config.description: Route configuration determines how this route will handle incoming requests

name.label: Name
name.tooltip: The name of the Route. Route names must be unique, and they are case sensitive. For example, there can be two different Routes named 'test' and 'Test'.

service.label: Gateway Service
service.tooltip: The Service this Route is associated to. This is where the Route proxies traffic to.

tags.label: Tags
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings associated with the Route for grouping and filtering.
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by commas

protocols.label: Protocols
protocols.tooltip: Routes have a protocols property to restrict the client protocol they should listen for.
protocols.tooltipConfig: An array of the protocols this Route should allow. See the {code1} section for a list of accepted protocols. When set to only {code2}, HTTP requests are answered with an upgrade error. When it is set to only {code3}, this is essentially the same as {code4} in that both HTTP and HTTPS requests are allowed. Default: {code5}.

path_handling.label: Path Handling
path_handling.tooltip: This treats service.path, route.path and request path as segments of a URL.
path_handling.tooltipConfig: Controls how the Service path, Route path and requested path are combined when sending a request to the upstream. See above for a detailed description of each behavior.

https_redirect_status_code.label: HTTPS Redirect Status Code
https_redirect_status_code.tooltip: The status code Kong responds with when all properties of a Route match except the protocol i.e. if the protocol of the request is {code1} instead of {code2}. {code3}  header is injected by Kong if the field is set to 301, 302, 307 or 308. Note: This config applies only if the Route is configured to only accept the {code4} protocol.

regex_priority.label: Regex Priority
regex_priority.tooltip: A number used to choose which route resolves a given request when several routes match it using regexes simultaneously. When two routes match the path and have the same {code1}, the older one (lowest {code2}) is used. Note that the priority for non-regex routes is different (longer non-regex routes are matched before shorter ones).

strip_path.label: Strip Path
strip_path.tooltip: When matching a Route via one of the {code1}, strip the matching prefix from the upstream request URL.

preserve_host.label: Preserve Host
preserve_host.tooltip: When matching a Route via one of the {code1} domain names, use the request {code2} header in the upstream request headers. If set to {code3}, the upstream {code4} header will be that of the Service's {code5}.

paths.label: Paths
paths.tooltip: AA list of paths that match this Route.

snis.label: SNIs
snis.tooltip: A list of SNIs (Server Name Indications from a TLS ClientHello) that match this Route.

hosts.label: Hosts
hosts.tooltip: A list of domain names that match this Route.
hosts.tooltipConfig: A list of domain names that match this Route. Note that the hosts value is case sensitive.

methods.label: Methods
methods.tooltip: A list of HTTP methods that match this Route.

custom.label: Custom
custom.tooltip: Custom methods can be used with default selections. Uppercase characters are required.

headers.label: Headers
headers.tooltip: Header values can be separated by commas (value1, value2, value3).
headers.tooltipConfig: One or more lists of values indexed by header name that will cause this Route to match if present in the request. The {code1} header cannot be used with this attribute: hosts should be specified using the {code2} attribute. When {code3} contains only one value and that value starts with the special prefix {code4], the value is interpreted as a regular expression.

sources.label: Sources
sources.tooltip: A list of IP sources of incoming connections that match this Route when using stream routing.

destinations.label: Destinations
destinations.tooltip: A list of IP destinations of incoming connections that match this Route when using stream routing.

response_buffering.label: Response buffering
response_buffering.tooltip: Whether to enable response body buffering or not. With HTTP 1.1, it may make sense to turn this off on services that send data with chunked transfer encoding.

request_buffering.label: Request buffering
request_buffering.tooltip: Whether to enable request body buffering or not. With HTTP 1.1, it may make sense to turn this off on services that receive data with chunked transfer encoding.

priority.label: Priority
priority.tooltip: A number used to choose which route resolves a given request when several routes match it using expression simultaneously.

warning.rulesMessage: For {protocol}, at least one of {routingRules} must be set.

cannotChangeFlavor.create: The format of the route cannot be changed once created.
cannotChangeFlavor.edit: This route was configured in the {format} format. It cannot be changed after creation, please switch to the {format} tab or create a new route instead.
